channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-6793] Make hbase-examples module
item.description: There are some examples under /examples/, which are not compiled as a part of the build. We can move them to an hbase-examples module.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This would make sense. Perhaps we could move other example code to it:


./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/backup/example/HFileArchiveManager.java

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/backup/example/HFileArchiveTableMonitor.java

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/backup/example/LongTermArchivingHFileCleaner.java

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/backup/example/TableHFileArchiveTracker.java

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/backup/example/ZKTableArchiveClient.java

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/example/ZooKeeperScanPolicyObserver.java

./hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/backup/example/TestZooKeeperTableArchiveClient.java

./hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/coprocessor/example/TestZooKeeperScanPolicyObserver.java

+1 sounds good. Just have to make sure we don't forget to fix the tests when they break, even if they are in another module.

Are you thinking to make hbase-examples dependent on all the modules?
+1 on a separate example module and moving existing example code there. Will that code ship with HBase (in both source and compiled form)?
+1. Just added another example CP in HBASE-5448 as well. Keeping these in a separate module to make them easy to find makes sense.

In an earlier multi-module ant+ivy project, I did smt like 


examples jar -> core jar 

core test jar -> examples jar

where -> is "depends on". However, things got ugly after that, since you have to build core jar first, then examples, and then core tests. I am not sure how maven can handle that. We can make examples depend on everything, but if we want to make use of classes in the examples inside tests (like hbase-server\src\test), then we might have to see whether it can be doable. If we don't want to do that, then we can just put all examples stuff there, and make it depend on hbase-server.

Examples currently require thrift generation.
Any objections to checking in generated code for them in order to avoid adding thrift dependency?
(thrift executable as opposed to just the lib)

Currently we check in protobuf generated code into hbase anyways, so I don't see a huge problem with that as long as the .thrift files are also checked in with a README that gives you the command to generate the files. See hbase-server/src/main/protobuf for an example.
+1 to committing thrift generated code. I could not find a thrift compiler that does not depend on thrift installed in path.

Here's the patch #1.
I'd prefer to move the remaining examples into the module as a next step, because this is already too big. Or I can keep working on the same patch, but if something intervenes there's a risk of this sitting around in JIRA

The patch:
1) Creates the module.
2) Ports the mapreduce examples as is.
3) Ports, adds thrift-generated code, and touches up thrift (not thrift2 yet) examples:
a) Java example builds and runs "out of the box".
b) Perl/PHP/Ruby/Python examples run, but some of them are out of date: they bail out when something that should produce error doesn't. I found some old Jira-s to fix that for Java and CPP; these should be updated similarly. I think this should also be a separate Jira (or -s).
c) CPP example cannot be built in mvn in absence of native thrift/boost, so it's copied in sources and user can set up the above and run `make`.
https://reviews.apache.org/r/7626/
Sergey Shelukhin good stuff sergey! its definitely a massive patch - feel free to file follow-ons for the rest of the stuff.
Updated the review at https://reviews.apache.org/r/7626/, created the jiras
I'll squash the changes and add final patch here when done with that review.
Attaching full patch so that the status would change...

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12549724/HBASE-6793-v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 82 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 11 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Patch looks great. Nice cleanup.

One question, will we be compiling of the examples every time we build now and running the tests? It seems so going by an invocation w/ this patch applied --> we are building an examples artifiact and it is full of code:

$ jar -tf hbase-examples/target/hbase-examples-0.95-SNAPSHOT.jar

When we built before this change, did we build example code as part of the general build? Do you know Sergey?

There's some example code in various places that are built; I assume tests for them are run. The root "examples" directory was not built; also, there were/are no tests in it. I think the plan is to move all the examples with their tests into this project (in HBASE-7003), and run the tests.
A couple more comments on RB Sergey Shelukhin, but otherwise its looks good to me.
whitespace (from CR feedback)

Sergey Shelukhin Does v5 address Jesse's comments up on RB?

I suppose as long as the tests do not take too long to build and unit test, it should be fine. Can always undo their build and running later if that is what we want.

Lets get this nice refactor committed (that /examples always bugged me)

When we built before this change, did we build example code as part of the general build? Do you know Sergey?

We were not building examples under /parent examples dir. This was one of the reasons that I filed this issue, so that the example code is compiled and we can ensure that it is not broken accidentally. I am not sure though about the non-java examples, I think we should not build them, since at least the thrift ones require thrift, boost, etc.

C++ example would require native thrift and boost to make as part of the mainline build.
Rb/pl/py/php examples can be added as a test that is run, however I am not sure this is wise (e.g. it would require the corresponding languages w/correct modules for perl/correct gems for ruby/... to be installed, as well as thrift).
I'll commit this unless objection later today.
THanks for the nice clean up Sergey. Committed to trunk.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #3516 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/3516/)
